chapters.title: Definition
chapters.text: Supply Chain Management is the management of systems or processes that create goods and/or provide services.

chapters.title: Entities
chapters.text: Entities part of the supply chain are producers, vendors, warehouses, transportation companies, distribution centers, and retailers. Functions in a supply chain vary from product development, marketing, operations, distribution, finance, and customer service.

chapters.title: Benefits
chapters.text: Benefits of Supply Chain Management include maximizing customer value, lowering costing while boosting profitability, achieving a sustainable competitive advantage, and ensuring the production cycle is faster.

chapters.title: Flows
chapters.text: The organizational supply chain is linked together through physical flows (transformation, movement and storage of goods & services) and information flows (the day-to-day flow of goods and materials up and down along supply chain partners).

chapters.title: Example
chapters.text: Manufacturing and supply chain operations make Zara unique in its industry. The factories are connected to the Global Distribution Center by underground tunnels with high-speed monorails to move cut fabric for dyeing and assembling. The monorail system allows returning finished products to the center for direct shipment to stores.
